Creating a Narrative Documentary

 

Master Class with FRONTLINE's Mike Wiser

:: :: ::

Tuesday, October 18, 2011, 5 – 6:30pm

Sever Hall 310, Harvard Yard

:: :: ::

SPONSOR: Harvard Law Documentary Studio

CONTACT E-MAIL: harvardlawdocs@gmail.com

:: :: ::

NOTE: This event is open to the public

:: :: ::

 


Emmy award-winning FRONTLINE producer Mike Wiser JD '03 will share his approach to taking a project from concept to narrative to pre-production plan.


The Harvard Law Documentary Studio welcomes the participation of anyone thinking of pursuing their own projects with or without the Documentary Studio's support, especially students who submitted Annual Project proposals. No video/film experience is necessary.


More on Mike Wiser: Since 2003, Mike has worked as an Emmy award-winning television producer, writer and journalist for the PBS series FRONTLINE. His most recent film "The Anthrax Files" (www.pbs.org…) looks into the FBI's investigation of the 2001 anthrax letter attacks. Other recent projects have included "Top Secret America" (www.pbs.org…), an examination of government secrecy in the government's war on terror, and "Death by Fire" (www.pbs.org…), an investigation into the execution of Cameron Todd Willingham. In 2009, he worked on investigations into the causes and fallout of the financial crisis in a series of films including "Inside the Meltdown," "Breaking the Bank," and the Emmy award-winning film "The Warning." In 2008, he served as a producer on the Emmy award-winning mini-series "Bush's War," a four-and-a-half-hour history of the Bush administration's foreign policy. Mike has also been nominated for a "New Approaches" Emmy for his role in producing an interactive web video timeline documenting American foreign policy after September 11th. Mike is a graduate of Harvard Law School and Middlebury College.

Questions? Email harvardlawdocs@gmail.com.
